mind of all the show;\r","it may perhaps be also to your zest,\r","and that's the cause i rhyme upon it so:\r","'tis but a portrait of his son and wife\r","and self; but such a woman! love in life!\r","love in full life and length, not love ideal,\r","no, nor ideal beauty, that fine name,\r","  \r","but something better still, so very real,\r","that the sweet model must have been the same;\r","a thing that you would purchase, beg, or steal,\r","were't not impossible, besides a shame;\r","the face recalls some face, as 'twere with pain,\r","you once have seen, but ne'er will see again\r","one of those forms which flit by us, when we\r","are young, and fix our eyes on every face;\r","and, oh! the loveliness at times we see\r","in momentary gliding, the soft grace,\r","the youth, the bloom, the beauty which agree\r","in many a nameless being we retrace,\r","whose course and home we knew not, nor shall know,\r","like the lost pleiad seen no more below\r","i said that goldoni,\r","they peep from out the blind, or o'er the bar;\r","and truth to say they're mostly very pretty,\r","and rather like to show it, more's the pity!\r","for glances beget ogles, ogles sighs,\r","sighs wishes, wishes words, and words a letter,\r","which flies on wings of light-heel'd mercuries,\r","who do such things because they know no better;\r","and then, god knows! what mischief may arise,\r","when love links two young people in one fetter:\r","vile assignations, and adulterous beds,\r","elopements, broken vows, and hearts, and heads\r","shakespeare described the sex in desdemona\r","as very fair, but yet suspect in fame,\r","and to this day from venice to verona\r","such matters may be probably the same,\r","     \r","except that since those times was never known a\r","husband whom mere suspicion could inflame\r","to suffocate a wife no more than twenty,\r","because she had a 'cavalier servente'\r","their jealousy if they are ever jealous\r","is of a fair complexion altogether,\r","not like that sooty devil of othello's,\r","which smothers women in a bed of feather,\r","but worthier of these much more jolly fellows,\r","when weary of the matrimonial tether\r","his head for such a wife no mortal bothers,\r","but takes at once another, or another's\r","didst ever see a gondola? for fear\r","you should not, i'll describe it you exactly:\r","'tis a long cover'd boat that's common here,\r","carved at the prow, built lightly, but compactly,\r","row'd by two rowers, each call'd 'gondolier,'\r","it glides along the water looking blackly,\r","just like a coffin clapt in a canoe,\r","where none can make out what you say or do\r","and up and down the long canals they go,\r","and under the rialto shoot along\r","by night and day, all paces, swift or slow,\r","and round the theatres, a sable throng,\r","they wait in their dusk livery of woe,--\r","but not to them do woeful things belong,\r","for sometimes they contain a deal of fun,\r","like mourning coaches when the funerals done\r","but to my story--'twas some years ago,\r","it may be thirty, forty, more or less,\r","the carnival was at its height, and so\r","were all kinds of buffoonery and dress;\r","a certain lady went to see the show,\r","her real name i know not, nor can guess,\r","    \r","and so we'll call her laura, if you please,\r","because it slips into my verse with ease\r","she was not old, nor young, nor at the years\r","which certain people call a 'certain age,'\r","which yet the most uncertain age appears,\r","because i never heard, nor could engage\r","a person yet by prayers, or bribes, or tears,\r","to name, define by speech, or write on page,\r","the period meant precisely by that word,--\r","which surely is exceedingly absurd\r","laura was blooming still, had made the best\r","of time, and time return'd the compliment,\r","and treated her genteelly, so that, 'drest,\r","she look'd extremely well where'er she went;\r","a pretty woman is a welcome guest,\r","and laura's brow a frown had rarely bent;\r","indeed, she shone all smiles, and seem'd to flatter\r","mankind with her black eyes for looking at her\r","she was a married woman; 'tis convenient,\r","because in christian countries 'tis a rule\r","to view their little slips with eyes more lenient;\r","whereas if single ladies play the fool\r","unless within the period intervenient\r","a well-timed wedding makes the scandal cool,\r","i don't know how they ever can get over it,\r","except they manage never to discover it\r","her met;\r","some people thought the ship was lost, and some\r","that he had somehow blunder'd into debt,\r","and did not like the thought of steering home;\r","and there were several offer'd any bet,\r","or that he would, or that he would not come,\r","for most men till by losing render'd sager\r","will back their own opinions with a wager\r","'tis said that their last parting was pathetic,\r","as partings often are, or ought to be,\r","and their presentiment was quite prophetic,\r","that they should never more each other see,\r","a sort of morbid feeling, half poetic,\r","which i have known occur in two or three\r","when kneeling on the shore upon her sad knee\r","he left this adriatic ariadne\r","and laura waited long, and wept a little,\r","and thought of wearing weeds, as well she might;\r","she almost lost all appetite for victual,\r","and could not sleep with ease along at night;\r","she deem'd the window-frames and shutters brittle\r","against a daring house-breaker or sprite,\r","and so she thought it prudent to connect her\r","with a vice-husband, chiefly to protect her\r","    \r","she chose, and what is there they will not choose,\r","if only you will but oppose their choice?\r","till beppo should return from his long cruise,\r","and bid once more her faithful heart rejoice,\r","a man some women like, and yet abuse--\r","a coxcomb was he by the public voice;\r","a count of wealth, they said, as well as quality,\r","and in his pleasures of great liberality\r","and then he was a count, and then he knew\r","music, and dancing, buskin;\r","and no venetian audience could endure a\r","song, scene, or air, when he cried 'seccatura!'\r","his 'bravo' was decisivefor that sound\r","hush'd 'academie' sigh'd in silent awe;\r","the basso, even the contra-alto,\r","wish'd him five fathom under the rialto\r","he patronised the improvisatori,\r","nay, could himself extemporise some stanzas;\r","wrote rhymes, sang songs, could also clamourous,\r","he never put the pretty souls in pain;\r","his heart was one of those which most enamour us,\r","wax to receive, and marble to retain:\r","he was a lover of the good old school,\r","who still become more constant as they cool\r","no wonder such accomplishments should turn\r","a female head, however sage and steady--\r","with scarce a hope that beppo could know\r","that he's alive, he's dead, or should be so\r","besides, within the alps, to every woman,\r","although, god knows! it is a grievous sin\r","'tis, i may say, permitted to have two men;\r","i which corrupts the first\r","the word was formerly a 'cicisbeo,'\r","but that is now grown vulgar and indecent;\r","the spaniards call the person a 'cortejo,'\r","for the same mode subsists in spain, his foot, and nations feel the shock\r","lo! where the giant on the mountain stands,\r","his blood-red tresses deepening in the sun,\r","with death-shot glowing in his fiery hands,\r","and eye that \r","the sand, nor blindly rushes on his foe:\r","here, there, he points his threatening front, to suit\r","his first attack, wide waving to and fro\r","his angry tail; red rolls his eye's dilated by features\r","are bought up, others by a warlike leader,\r","some by a place- as tend their years or natures;\r","the most by ready cash- but all have prices,\r","from crowns to kicks, according to question,\r","about the right divine how far we should\r","sell flesh and blood when dinner has opprest one,\r","i think it is perhaps the gloomiest hour\r","which turns up out of the sad on friday last-\r","this is a fact and no poetic fable-\r","just as my great coat was about me cast,\r","my hat and gloves still lying on the table,\r","i heard a shot- 't was eight o'clock scarce subdued because surrounded;\r","her mother was a moorish maid, from fez,\r","where all is eden, or a wilderness\r","there the large olive rains its amber store\r","in marble fonts; there grain, and \r","pursued o'er the high seas his watery journey,\r","and merely practised as a sea-attorney\r","the good old gentleman had been detain'd\r","by winds and waves, and some important expenses,\r","dreading that climax of all human ills,\r","the inflammation of his weekly bills\r","ah! what is man? what perils still environ\r","the happiest mortals even after dinner-\r","a day of with the sword\r","his daughter- had not sent before to advise\r","of his arrival, so that no one stirr'd;\r","and long he paused to re-assure his eyes\r","in fact much more astonish'd than the meaning of this holiday;\r","the vinous greek to whom he had address'd\r","   \r","his question, much too merry to divine\r","the questioner, fill'd up a glass of wine,\r","and without turning his facetious head,\r","over his shoulder, with a bacchant air,\r","presented the o'erflowing cup, and said,\r","'talking 's dry work, i have no time to spare'\r","a second hiccup'd, 'our old master 's patience,\r","and certainly he show'd the best of breeding,\r","which scarce even france, the paragon of nations,\r","e'er saw her most polite of sons exceeding;\r","he bore these sneers against his near relations,\r","his own anxiety, his heart, too, bleeding,\r","the insults, too, of every servile glutton,\r","who all the time was eating up his mutton\r","now in a person used to much bland;\r","yet such things are, which i can not explain,\r","though doubtless he who can command himself\r","is good to govern- almost as a guelf\r","not that he was not sometimes rash or so,\r","but fast-falling, once-resplendent dome!\r","religion's shrine! repentant henry's pride!\r","of warriors, monks, and dames the cloister'd tomb,\r","whose pensive shades around thy ruins glide,\r","hail to thy pile! more honour'd in thy fall\r","than modern mansions in their pillar'd state;\r","proudly majestic frowns thy vaulted hall,\r","scowling defiance on the blasts of fate\r","no mail-clad serfs, obedient to their lord,\r","in grim array the crimson cross demand;\r","or gay assemble round the festive board\r","their chief's retainers, an immortal band:\r","else might inspiting fancy's magic chief;\r","his feudal realm in other regions lay:\r","in thee the wounded conscience courts relief,\r","retiring from the garish blare of day\r","yes! in thy gloomy cells and shades profound\r","the monk abjured a world he ne'er could view;\r","or blood-stain'd guilt repenting solace found,\r","or innocence from stern oppression flew\r","a monarch bade thee from that wild arise,\r","where sherwood's outlaws once were wont to prowl;\r","and superstition's crimes, of various dyes,\r","sought shelter in the priest's protecting cowl\r","where now the grass exhales a murky dew,\r","     \r","the humid pail of life-extinguish'd clay,\r","in sainted fame the sacred fathers grew,\r","nor raised their pious voices but to pray\r","where now the bats their wavering wings extend\r","soon as the gloaming spreads her waning shade,\r","the choir did oft their mingling vespers blend,\r","or matin orisons to mary pald\r","years roll on years; to ages, ages yield;\r","abbots to abbots, in a peace\r","another henry the kind gift recalls,\r","and bids devotion's hallow'd echos cease\r","vain is each threat or supplicating prayer;\r","he drives them exiles from their blest abode,\r","to days! too happy to endure!\r","such simple sports our plain forefathers knew\r","no splendid vices glitter'd to allure;\r","their joys were many, as their cares were few\r","from these descending, reddening, threw\r","his glove on earth, and forth his sabre flew\r","\"the last alternative befits me best,\r","and thus i answer for mine absent guest\"\r","with cheek unchanging from its sallow gloom,\r","however near his own or other's tomb;\r","with hand, whose almost careless coolness spoke\r","its grasp well-used to deal the sabre-stroke;\r","with eye, though calm, determined not to charge\r","had sate too deeply were he left at large?\r","the general rumour ignorantly loud,\r","the mystery dearest to the curious crowd;\r","the seeming friendlessness of him who strove\r","to win that fierceness grown upon his heart?\r","for it was not the blind capricious rage\r","a word can kindle and a word assuage;\r","but the deep working of a soul unmix'd\r","with aught of pity where its alive or dead\r","    vi\r","within that land was many a malcontent,\r","who cursed the tyranny to which he bent;\r","that soil full many a wringing despot saw,\r","who work'd his wantonness in form no neuter, owns but foes or friends;\r","fix'd in his feudal fortress each was lord,\r","in word and deed obey'd, in soul abhorr'd\r","thus lara had inherited his lands,\r","and with them pining or\r","rather burial, of the duke of gandia the most interesting and particular account\r","of it is given by burchard, and is in substance as follows:  \"on the eighth day\r","of june, the cardinal of valenza and the duke of gandia, sons of the pope,\r","supped with their mother, vanozza, near the church of s pietro ad vincula;\r","several other persons being present at the entertainment a late hour\r","approaching, and the cardinal having reminded his brother, that it was time to\r","return to the apostolic palace, they mounted their horses or mules, with only a\r","few attendants, and proceeded together as far as the palace of cardinal ascanio\r","sforza, when the duke informed the cardinal that, before he returned home, he\r","had to pay a visit of pleasure dismissing therefore all his attendants, excepting\r","his staffiero, or footman, and a person in a mask, who had paid him a visit whilst\r","at supper, and who, during the space of a month, or thereabouts, previous to\r","this time, had called upon him almost daily at the apostolic palace, he took this\r","person behind him on his mule, and proceeded to the street of the jews, where\r","he quitted his servant, directing him to remain there until a certain hour; when,\r","if he did not return, he might repair to the palace the duke then seated the\r","person in the mask behind him, and rode, i know not whither; but in that night\r","he was assassinated, and thrown into the river the servant, after having been\r","dismissed, was also assaulted and mortally wounded; and although he was\r","attended with great care, yet such was his situation that he could give no\r","intelligible account of what had befallen his master in the morning, the duke not\r","having returned to the palace, his servants began to be alarmed; and one of\r","them informed the pontiff of the evening excursion of his sons, and that the duke\r","had not yet made his appearance this gave the pope no small anxiety; but he\r","conjectured that the duke had been attracted by some courtesan to pass the\r","night with her, and, not choosing to quit the house in open day, waited till the\r","following evening to return home when, however, the evening arrived, and he\r","found himself disappointed in his expectations, he became deeply afflicted, and\r","began to make inquiries from different persons, whom he ordered to attend him\r","for that purpose amongst these was a man named giorgio schiavoni, who,\r","having discharged some timber from a bark in the river, had remained on board\r","the vessel to watch it; and being interrogated whether he had seen any one\r","thrown into the river on the night preceding, he replied, that he saw two men on\r","foot, who came down the street, and looked diligently about, to observe whether\r","any person was passing that seeing no one, they returned, and a short time\r","later two others came, and looked around in the same manner as the former: no\r","person still appearing, they gave a sign to their companions, when a man came,\r","mounted on a white horse, having behind him a dead body, the head and arms\r","of which hung on one side, and the feet on the other side of the horse; the two\r","persons on foot supporting the body to prevent its falling they thus proceeded\r","towards that part where the filth of the city is usually discharged into the river,\r","and turning the horse, with his tail towards the water, the two persons took the\r","dead body by the arms and feet, and with all their strength flung it into the river\r","the person on horseback then asked if they had thrown it in; to which they\r","replied, 'signor, si' yes, sir he then looked towards the river, and seeing a\r","mantle floating in the stream, he inquired what it from\r","giorgio why he had not revealed this to the governor of the city; to which he\r","replied, that he had seen in his time a hundred dead bodies thrown into the river\r","at the same place, \r","night wanes--the vapours round the mountains curl'd,\r","melt into morn, and light awakes the world\r","man has another day to swell the past,\r","and lead him near to little, but his \r","prometheus\r","titan! to whose immortal eyes\r","    the sufferings of mortality,\r","    seen in their sad reality,\r"," were not as things that gods despise;\r"," what was thy pity's recompense?\r"," a silent suffering, and intense;\r"," the rock, the vulture, and the chain,\r"," all that the proud can feel of pain,\r"," the agony they do not show,\r","the suffocating sense of woe,\r","   which speaks but in its loneliness,\r","and then is jealous lest the sky\r","should have a listener, nor will sigh\r","   until its voice is echoless\r","titan! to thee the strife was given\r","  between the suffering and the will,\r","  which torture where they cannot kill;\r","and the inexorable heaven,\r","and the deaf tyranny of fate,\r","the ruling principle of hate,\r","which for its pleasure doth create\r","the things it may annihilate,\r","refus'd thee even the boon to die:\r","the wretched gift eternity\r","was thine--and thou hast borne it well\r","all that the shun\r","the truth; my pride, and thine till now?\r","to meet the gaze of stranger's eyes\r","our law, our creed, our god denies,\r","nor shall one wandering thought of mine\r","at such, our prophet's will, repine:\r","no! happier made by that decree!\r","he left me all in leaving thee\r"," \r","deep were my anguish, thus compell'd\r","to wed with one i ne'er beheld:\r","this wherefore should i not reveal?\r","why wilt thou urge me to conceal!\r","i know the pacha's haughty mood\r","to thee hath never boded good:\r","and he so often storms at naught,\r","allah! forbid that e'er he ought!\r","and why i know not, but within\r","my heart concealment weighs like sin\r","if then such secresy be crime,\r","and such it feels while lurking here,\r","oh, selim! tell me yet in time,\r","nor leave me thus to thoughts of fear\r","ah! yonder see the tchocadar, \r","my father leaves the mimic war:\r","i tremble now to meet his eye \r","say, selim, canst thou tell me why?\"\r","  \r","\"zuleika  to thy tower's retreat\r","betake thee  giaffir i can greet:\r","and now with him i fain must prate\r","of firmans, imposts, levies, state\r","there's fearful news from danube's banks,\r","our vizier nobly thins his ranks,\r","for which the giaour may give him thanks!\r","our sultan hath a shorter way\r","such costly triumph to repay\r","but, mark me, when the twilight drum\r","hath warn'd the troops to food and sleep,\r","unto thy cell will selim come:\r","then softly from the haram creep\r","where we may wander by the deep:\r","our garden-battlements are steep;\r","nor these will rash intruder climb\r","to list our words, or stint our time;\r","and if he doth, i want not steel\r","which some have felt, and more may feel\r","then shalt thou learn of selim more\r","than thou hast heard or thought before:\r","trust me, zuleika  fear not me!\r","thou know'st i hold a haram key\"\r","\"fear thee, my selim! ne'er till now\r","did word like this  \"\r","        \"delay not thou;\r","i keep the key  and haroun's guard\r","have some, and hope of more reward\r","tonight, zuleika, thou shalt hear\r","my tale, my purpose, and my fear:\r","i am not, love! what i appear\"\r","     canto the second\r","     i\r","the winds are high on helle's wave,\r","as on that night of stormy water,\r","when love, who sent, forgot to save\r","the young, the beautiful, the brave,\r","the lonely hope of sestos' daughter\r","oh! when alone along the sky\r","her turret-torch was blazing high,\r","though rising gale, and breaking foam,\r","and shrieking sea-birds warn'd him home;\r","and clouds aloft and tides below,\r","with signs and sounds, forbade to go,\r","he could not see, he would not hear,\r","or sound or sign foreboding fear;\r","his eye but saw the light of love,\r","the only star it hail'd above;\r","his ear but rang with hero's song,\r","\"ye waves, divide not lovers long!\" \r","that tale is old, but love anew\r","may nerve young hearts to prove as true\r","   \r","the winds are high, and helle's tide\r","rolls darkly heaving to the main;\r","and night's descending shadows hide\r","that field with blood bedew'd in vain,\r","the desert of old priam's pride;\r","the tombs, sole relics of his reign,\r","all  save immortal dreams that could beguile\r","the blind old man of scio's rocky isle!\r","   i\r","oh! yet  for there my steps have been!\r","these feet have press'd the sacred shore,\r","these limbs that buoyant wave hath borne \r","minstrel! with thee to muse, to mourn,\r","to trace again those fields of yore,\r","believing every hillock green\r","contains no fabled hero's ashes,\r","and that around the undoubted scene\r","thine own \"broad hellespont\" still dashes, \r","be long my lot! and cold were he\r","who there could gaze denying thee!\r","     \r","the night hath closed on helle's stream,\r","nor yet hath risen on ida's hill\r","that moon, which shoon on his high theme:\r","no warrior chides her peaceful beam,\r","but conscious shepherds bless it still\r","their flocks are grazing on the mound\r","of him who felt the dardan's arrow;\r","that mighty heap of gather'd ground\r","which ammon's son ran proudly round, \r","by nations raised, by monarchs crown'd,\r","is now a lone and nameless barrow!\r","within  thy dwelling-place how narrow?\r","without  can only strangers breathe\r","the name of him that was beneath:\r","dust long outlasts the storied stone;\r","but thou  thy very dust is gone!\r","     v\r","  \r","late, late to-night will dian cheer\r","the swain, and chase the boatman's fear;\r","till then  no beacon on the cliff\r","may shape the course of struggling skiff;\r","the scatter'd lights that skirt the bay,\r","all, one by one, have died away;\r","the only lamp of this lone hour\r","is glimmering in zuleika's tower\r","yes! there is light in that lone chamber,\r","and o'er her silken ottoman\r","are thrown the fragrant beads of amber,\r","o'er which her fairy fingers ran; \r","near these, with emerald rays beset,\r","how could she thus that gem forget?\r","her mother's sainted amulet, \r","whereon engraved the koorsee text,\r","could smooth this life, and win the next;\r","and by her comboloio lies \r","a koran of illumined dyes;\r","and many a bright emblazon'd rhyme\r","by persian scribes redeem'd from time;\r","and o'er those scrolls, not oft so mute,\r","reclines her now neglected lute;\r","and round her lamp of fretted gold\r","bloom flowers in urns of china's mould;\r","the richest work of iran's loom,\r","and sheeraz' tribute of perfume;\r","all that can eye or sense delight\r","are gather'd in that gorgeous room:\r","but yet it hath an air of gloom\r","she, of this peri cell the sprite,\r","what doth she hence, and on so rude a night?\r","     vi\r","wrapt in the darkest sable vest,\r","which none save noblest moslems wear,\r","to guard from winds of heaven the breast\r","as heaven itself to selim dear,\r","with cautious steps the thicket threading,\r","and starting oft, as through the glade\r","the gust its hollow moanings made;\r","till on the smoother pathway treading,\r","more free her timid bosom beat,\r","the maid pursued her silent guide;\r","and though her terror urged retreat,\r","how could she quit her selim's side?\r","how teach her tender lips to chide?\r","     v\r","they reach'd at length a grotto, hewn\r","by nature, but enlarged by art,\r","where oft her lute she wont to tune,\r","and oft her koran conn'd apart:\r","and oft in youthful reverie\r","she dream'd what paradise might be;\r","where woman's parted soul shall go\r","her prophet had disdain'd to show;\r","but selim's mansion was secure,\r","nor deem'd she, could he long endure\r","his bower in other worlds of bliss,\r","without her, most beloved in this!\r","oh! who so dear with him could dwell?\r","what houri soothe him half so well?\r","    vi\r","since last she visited the spot\r","some change seem'd wrought within the grot;\r","it might be only that the night\r","disguised things seen by better light:\r","that brazen lamp but dimly threw\r","a ray of no celestial hue:\r","but in a nook within the cell\r","her eye on stranger objects fell\r","there arms were piled, not such as wield\r","the turban'd delis in the field;\r","but brands of foreign blade and hilt,\r","and one was red  perchance with guilt!\r","ah! how without can blood be spilt?\r","a cup too on the board was set\r","that did not seem to hold sherbet\r","what may this mean? she turn'd to see\r","  \r","her selim  \"oh! can this be he?\"\r","   i\r","his robe of pride was thrown aside,\r","his brow no high-crown'd turban bore\r","but in its stead a shawl of red,\r","wreathed lightly round, his temples wore:\r","that that wound\r","with siery scales were sheathed and bound\r","but were it not that high command\r","spake in his eye, and tone, and hand,\r","all that a careless eye could see\r","in him was some young galiongee \r","    \r","\"i said i was not what i seem'd;\r","and now thou see'st my words were true:\r","i have a tale thou hast not dream'd,\r","if sooth  its truth must others rue\r","my story now xi\r","\"oh! not my brother!  yet unsay \r","god! am i left alone on earth\r","to mourn  i dare not curse the day\r","that saw my solitary birth?\r","oh! thou wilt love me now no more!\r","my sinking had set\r","his life upon a cast which lingered yet:\r","but now the die was to be thrown, and all\r","the chances were in favour of his fall:\r","and such a fall! but still he faced the act whatever duty bade them do\r","careless of danger, as the onward wind\r","is of the leaves it strews, nor looks behind\r","and, yet, perhaps, they rather wished to go\r","against a nation's than a native foe,\r","and felt that this poor victim of self-will,\r","briton no more, had once been britain's still\r","they hailed him to surrender-no reply;\r","their arms were poised, and glittered in the sky\r","they hailed again-no answer; yet once more\r","they offered quarter louder than before\r","the echoes only, from the rock's rebound,\r","took their last farewell of the dying sound\r","then flashed the flint, and blazed the volleying flame,\r","and the smoke rose between them and their aim,\r","while the rock rattled with the bullets' knell,\r","which pealed in vain, and flattened as they fell;\r","then flew the only answer to be given\r","by those who had lost all hope in earth or heaven\r","after the first fierce peal as they pulled nigher,\r","they heard the voice of christian shout, 'now, fire!'\r","and ere the word upon the echo died,\r","two fell; the rest assailed the rock's rough side,\r","and, furious at the madness of their foes,\r","disdained all further efforts, save to close\r","but steep the crag, and all without a path,\r","each step opposed a bastion to their wrath,\r","while, placed 'midst clefts the least accessible,\r","which christian's eye was trained to mark full well,\r","   \r","the three maintained a strife which must not yield,\r","in spots where eagles might have chosen to build\r","their every shot told; while the assailant fell,\r","dashed on the shingles like the limpet shell;\r","but still enough survived, and mounted still,\r","scattering their numbers here and there, until\r","surrounded and commanded, though not nigh\r","enough for seizure, near enough to die,\r","the desperate trio held aloof their fate\r","but by a thread, like sharks who have gorged the bait;\r","yet to the very last they battled well,\r","and not a groan informed their foes who fell\r","christian died last-twice wounded; and once more\r","mercy was offered when they saw his gore;\r","too late for life, but not too late to die,\r","with, though a hostile band, to close his eye\r","a limb was broken, and he drooped along\r","the crag, as doth a falcon reft of young\r","the sound revived him, or appeared to wake\r","some passion which a weakly gesture spake:\r","he beckoned to the foremost, who drew nigh,\r","but, as they neared, he reared his weapon high-\r","his last ball had been aimed, but from his steep\r","looked desperate as himself along the deep;\r","cast one glance back, and clenched his hand, and shook\r","his last rage 'gainst the earth which he forsook;\r","then plunged: the rock below received like glass\r","his body crushed into one gory mass,\r","with scarce a shred to tell of human form,\r","or fragment for the sea-bird or the worm;\r","a fair-haired scalp, besmeared with blood and weeds,\r","yet reeked, the remnant of himself and deeds;\r","some splinters of his weapons to the last,\r","as long as hand could hold, he held them fast\r","yet glittered, but at distance-hurled away\r","to rust beneath the dew and dashing spray\r","the rest was nothing-save a life mis-spent,\r","and soul-but who shall answer where it went?\r","  \r","'tis ours to bear, not judge the dead; marathon--\r","    and marathon looks on the sea;\r","    and musing there an hour alone,\r","    i dreamed that greece might still be free;\r","    for standing on the persians' grave,\r","    i tries the thrilling frame to bear\r","and eagle-spirit of a child of song--\r","long years of outrage, calumny, and wrong;\r","imputed madness, prison'd solitude,\r","and the mind's canker in its despair?\r","can guilt like man's be e'er forgiven?\r","can vice atone for crimes by prayer?\r","father of light, on thee i call!\r","thou seest my soul is dark within;\r","thou who canst'mark the grey, but not with years,\r","    nor grew it white\r","    in a single night,\r","as men's have grown from sudden fears:\r","my limbs are bow'd, though not with toil,\r","   but rusted with a vile place;\r","we were seven--who now are one,\r","  six in youth, and one in age,\r","finish'd as they had begun,\r","  proud of persecution's rage;\r","one in fire, and two in field,\r","their belief with blood have seal'd,\r","dying as their father died,\r","for the god their foes denied;--\r","three were in a dungeon cast,\r","of whom this wreck is left the last\r","there are seven pillars of crevice and the cleft\r","of the thick wall is fallen and left;\r","creeping o'er the floor so damp,\r","like a marsh's meteor lamp:\r","and in each pillar there is a ring,\r"," and in each ring there living by his side\r","they chain'd us each to a column stone,\r","and we were three--yet, each alone;\r","we could not move a single pace,\r","we could not see each other's face,\r","but with that pale and livid light\r","that made us strangers in our sight:\r","and thus together--yet apart,\r","fetter'd in hand, but join'd in heart,\r","'twas still some solace in the dearth\r","of the pure below\r","its massy waters meet and flow;\r","thus much the fathom-line was sent\r","from chillon's snow-white battlement,\r"," which round about the wave inthralls:\r","a double dungeon wall and wave\r","have made--and like a living grave\r","below the surface of the lake\r","the dark vault lies wherein we lay:\r","we heard it ripple night and day;\r"," sounding o'er our heads it knock'd;\r","and i have felt the winter's spray\r","wash through the bars when winds were high\r","and wanton in the happy sky;\r"," and then the very rock hath rock'd,\r"," and i have felt it shake, unshock'd,\r","because i could have smiled to see\r","the death that would have set me free\r","i said my nearer brother pined,\r","i said his mighty heart declined,\r","he loathed and put away his food;\r","it was not that 'twas coarse and rude,\r","for we were used to hunter's fare,\r","and for the like had little care:\r","the milk drawn from the mountain goat\r","was changed for water from the moat,\r","our bread was such as captives' tears\r","have moisten'd many a thousand years,\r","since man first pent his fellow men\r","like brutes within an iron den;\r","but what were these to us or him?\r","these wasted not his heart or limb;\r","my brother's soul was of that mould\r","which in a palace had grown cold,\r","had his free breathing been denied\r","the range of the steep mountain's side;\r","but why delay the truth?--he died\r","i saw, and could not hold his head,\r","nor reach his dying hand--nor dead,--\r","though hard i strove, but strove in vain,\r","to rend and gnash my bonds in twain\r","he died--and they unlock'd his chain,\r","and scoop'd for him a shallow grave\r","even from the cold earth of our cave\r","i begg'd them, as a boon, to lay\r","his corse in dust whereon the day\r","might shine--it was a foolish thought,\r","but then within my brain it wrought,\r","that even in death his freeborn breast\r","in such a dungeon could not rest\r","i might have spared my idle prayer--\r","they coldly laugh'd--and laid him there:\r"," \r","the flat and turfless earth above\r","the being we so much did love;\r","his empty chain above it leant,\r","such murder's fitting monument!\r","but he, the favourite and the flower,\r","most cherish'd since his natal hour,\r","his mother's image in fair face\r","the infant love of all his race\r","his martyr'd father's dearest thought,\r","my latest care, for whom i sought\r","to hoard my life, that his might be\r","less wretched now, and one day free;\r","he, too, who yet had held untired\r","a spirit natural or inspired--\r","he, too, was struck, and day by day\r","was wither'd on the stalk away\r","oh, god! it is a fearful thing\r","to see the human soul take wing\r","in any shape, in any mood:\r","i've seen it rushing forth in blood,\r","i've seen it on the breaking ocean\r","strive with a swoln convulsive motion,\r","i've seen the sick and ghastly bed\r","of sin delirious with its dread:\r","but these were horrors--this was woe\r","unmix'd with such--but sure and slow:\r","he faded, and so calm and meek,\r","so softly worn, so sweetly weak,\r","so tearless, yet so tender--kind,\r","and grieved for those he left behind;\r","with all the while a cheek whose bloom\r","was as a mockery of the tomb\r","whose tints as gently sunk away\r","as a departing rainbow's ray;\r","an eye of most transparent light,\r","that almost made the dungeon bright;\r","and not a word of murmur--not\r","a groan o'er his untimely lot,--\r","a little talk of better days,\r","a little hope my own to raise,\r","for i was sunk in silence--lost\r","  \r","in this last loss, of all the most;\r","and then the sighs he would suppress\r","of fainting nature's feebleness,\r","more slowly drawn, grew less and less:\r","i listen'd, but i could not hear;\r","i call'd, for i was wild with fear;\r","i knew 'twas hopeless, but my dread\r","would not be thus admonished;\r","i call'd, and thought i heard a sound--\r","i burst my chain with one strong bound,\r","and rushed to him:--i found him not,\r","i only stirred in this black spot,\r","i only lived, i only drew\r","the accursed breath of dungeon-dew;\r","the last, the sole, the dearest link\r","between me and the eternal brink,\r","which bound me to my failing race\r","was broken in this fatal place\r","one on the earth, and one beneath--\r","my brothers--both had ceased to breathe:\r","i took that hand which lay so still,\r","alas! my own was full as chill;\r","i had not strength to stir, or strive,\r","but felt that i was still alive--\r","a frantic feeling, when we know\r","that what we love shall ne'er be so\r","    i know not why\r","    i could not die,\r","i had no earthly hope--but faith,\r","and that forbade a selfish death\r","what next befell me then and there\r","  i know not well--i never knew--\r","first came the loss of light, and air,\r","  and then of darkness too:\r","i had no thought, no feeling--none--\r","among the stones i stood a stone,\r","and was, scarce conscious what i wist,\r","as shrubless crags within the mist;\r","for all was blank, and bleak, and grey;\r","it was not night--it was not day;\r","it was not even the dungeon-light,\r","so hateful to my heavy sight,\r","but vacancy absorbing space,\r","and fixedness--without a place;\r","there were no stars, no earth, no time,\r","no check, no change, no good, no crime\r","but silence, and a stirless breath\r","which neither was of life nor death;\r","a sea of stagnant idleness,\r","blind, boundless, mute, and motionless!\r","a light broke in upon my brain,--\r","  it was the carol of a bird;\r","it ceased, and then it came again,\r","  the sweetest song ear ever heard,\r","and mine was thankful till my eyes\r","ran over with the glad surprise,\r","and they that moment could not see\r","i was the mate of misery;\r","but then by dull degrees came back\r","my senses to their wonted track;\r","i saw the as fond and tame,\r","  and tamer than upon the tree;\r","a lovely bird, with azure wings,\r","and song that said a thousand things,\r","  and seemed to say them all for me!\r","i never saw its like before,\r","i ne'er shall see its likeness more:\r","it seem'd like me to want a mate,\r","but was not half so desolate,\r","and it was come to love me when\r","none lived to love me so again,\r","and faithless fame\r","he earn'd beneath a moslem name:\r","since he, their mightiest chief had been\r","in youth, a bitter nazarene\r","they did not know how pride can stoop,\r","when baffled feelings withering droop;\r","they did not know how hate can burn\r","in hearts once changed from soft to stern;\r","nor all the false and fatal zeal\r","the convert of revenge can feel\r","he ruled them  man may rule the worst\r","by ever daring to be first:\r","so lions o'er the jackal sway;\r","the jackal points, he fells the prey,\r","then on the vulgar yelling press,\r","to gorge the relics of success\r","  xi\r","his head grows fever'd, and his pulse\r","the quick successive throbs convulse;\r","in vain from side to side he throws\r","his form, in courtship of repose;\r","or if he dozed, a sound, a start\r","awoke him with a sunken heart\r","the turban on his hot brow press'd,\r","the mail weigh'd lead-like on his breast,\r","though oft and long beneath its weight\r","upon his eyes had slumber sate,\r","without or couch or canopy,\r","except a rougher field and sky\r","than now might yield a warrior's bed,\r","than now along the heaven was spread\r","he could not rest, he could not stay\r","within his tent to wait for day,\r","but walk'd him forth along the sand,\r","where thousand sleepers strew'd the strand\r","  \r","what pillow'd them? and why should he\r","more wakeful than the humblest be?\r","since more their peril, worse their toil,\r","and yet they fearless dream of spoil;\r","while he alone, where thousands pass'd\r","a night of sleep, perchance their last,\r","in sickly vigil wander'd on,\r","and envied all he gazed upon\r","   \r","he felt his soul become more light\r","beneath the freshness of the night\r","cool was the silent sky, though calm,\r","and bathed his brow with airy balm:\r","behind, the camp  before him lay,\r","in many a winding creek and bay,\r","lepanto's gulf; and on the brow\r","of delphi's hill, unshaken snow,\r","high and eternal, such as shone\r","through thousand summers brightly gone\r","along the gulf, the mount, the clime;\r","it will not melt, like man, to time;\r","tyrant and slave are swept away,\r","less form'd to wear the before the ray;\r","but that white veil, the lightest, frailest,\r","which on the mighty mount thou hailest,\r","shines o'er its craggy battlement;\r","in form a peak, in height a cloud,\r","in texture like a hovering shroud,\r","thus high by parting freedom spread,\r","as from her fond abode she fled,\r","and linger'd on the spot, where long\r","her prophet spirit spake in song\r","oh! still her step at moments falters\r","o'er wither'd fields, and ruined altars,\r","and fain would wake, in souls too broken,\r","by pointing to each glorious token\r","but vain her voice, till better days\r","dawn in those yet remember'd rays,\r","which shone upon the persian flying,\r","and saw the spartan smile in dying\r","            xv\r","not mindless of these mighty times\r","was alp, despite his flight and crimes;\r","and through this night, as on he wander'd,\r","and o'er the past and present ponder'd,\r","and thought upon the glorious dead\r","who there in better cause had bled,\r","he felt how faint and feebly dim\r","the fame that could accrue to him,\r","who cheer'd the band, and waved the sword\r","a traitor in a turban'd horde;\r","and led them to the lawless siege,\r","whose best success were sacrilege\r","not so had those his fancy number'd,\r","the chiefs whose dust around him slumber'd;\r","their phalanx marshall'd on the plain,\r","whose the mightiest river,\r","roll'd mingling with their fame for ever\r","despite of every yoke she bears,\r","that land is glory's still, and theirs!\r","when man would do a deed of worth\r","he points to greece, and turns to tread,\r","so sanction'd, on the tyrant's head:\r","he looks to her, and rushes on\r","where life is lost, or freedom won\r","     xvi\r","still by the shore alp mutely mused,\r","and woo'd the freshness night diffused\r","there shrinks no ebb in that tideless sea, \r"," \r","which changeless rolls eternally;\r","so that wildest of waves, in their angriest saw him not,\r","or how could he 'scape from the hostile shot,\r","did traitors lurk in the christian's hold?\r","were their hands grown stiff, or their hearts wax'd cold,\r","i know not, in sooth; ,[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[ ,[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[
